finalescape.mapcomponent

Class MapComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalescape.mapcomponent.MapComponent
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Character, Desk, ItemComponent, ProjectileComponent, Wall

    public abstract class MapComponent
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for items going in the Map. Somewhat similar to the Actor class in GridWorld (kinda).
    Author:
    Ofek Gila
    See Also:
    Wall, Teacher, ItemComponent, Map

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapComponent(Map map, int x, int y, java.lang.String name)
      Call this constructor when creating a new MapComponent to place in a Map.
      MapComponent(java.lang.String name)
      Call this constructor when creating a new MapComponent to not immediately place in a map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapComponent

        public MapComponent(Map map,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    java.lang.String name)
        Call this constructor when creating a new MapComponent to place in a Map.
        Parameters:
        map - the Map to place in
        x - x coordinate
        y - y coordinate
        name - name of the coordinate (should have image file in images/[name].png)

      • MapComponent

        public MapComponent(java.lang.String name)
        Call this constructor when creating a new MapComponent to not immediately place in a map.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the coordinate (should have image file in images/[name].png)

    • Method Detail

      • moveTo

        public final void moveTo(int x,
                         int y)
        Move this MapComponent to a specific location in the Map. If you think you should modify this, you're probably doing something wrong.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate to move to
        y - y coordinate to move to

      • getImageByName

        public static java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImageByName(java.lang.String name,
                                                          int size)
        Gets an image at a specific dimension (size x size) corresponding to this MapComponents name (located at images/[name].png).
        Parameters:
        name - name of the MapComponent
        size - size of the dimension
        Returns:
        BufferedImage the image generated

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(int size)
        Tries getting (or generating) an image for this MapComponent
        Parameters:
        size - size of image
        Returns:
        BufferedImage the image of this MapComponent

        Returns:
        true if update prevented, false otherwise

      • setPrecedence

        public void setPrecedence(int precedence)
        Sets precedence of this MapComponent. For example, a component with a precedence of 5 will tick before one with a precedence of 3.
        Parameters:
        precedence - the precedence value to set

      • setDelayInterval

        public void setDelayInterval(int interval)
        Sets the delay interval (an interval of 20 means that it ticks once every 20 game ticks (like Teachers)). There is a tick every 50 ms.
        Parameters:
        interval - the length of the interval

      • preventUpdate

        public void preventUpdate(int numMoves)
        Prevents updating this MapComponent a specific number of times (used for 'stunning' components).
        Parameters:
        numMoves - how many moves to prevent updating

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Called whenever this MapComponent should update. Override (like the 'act' method in GridWorld, but infinitely better).

      • instof

        public final boolean instof(java.lang.Object obj1,
                            java.lang.Object obj2)
        A sweet pseudo-instanceof except dynamic.
        Parameters:
        obj1 - one of the Objects to use
        obj2 - the other
        Returns:
        true if is an instanceof, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this MapComponent (by default removes from map), but can be overridden.
        See Also:
        Failure.destroy()

      • distance

        public double distance(MapComponent that)
        Distance between this MapComponent to another
        Parameters:
        that - the other MapComponent
        Returns:
        the 'as the crow flies' distance between them

      • solveMazeDirection

        public Direction solveMazeDirection(MapComponent componentTo)
        Finds the Direction to face to get to the target MapComponent.
        Parameters:
        componentTo - the target MapComponent
        Returns:
        the Direction to face
        See Also:
        Map.solveMazeDirection(finalescape.mapcomponent.MapComponent, finalescape.mapcomponent.MapComponent)
